title: Umanotera: NGO for sustainable development and environment

author: Gaja Brecelj, Umanotera, Slovenska fundacija za trajnostni razvoj

segmentation: The next presenter presenter actually is going to talk about organization that in the last couple of years inspired me a lot about their visions about their dedication of volunteer work that is associated with them, and I'm sure that they they are an inspiration to other NGOs as well.
Omono Terra, the NGO for Sustainable Development and environment, and it's going to be presented.
Their case by Gaia Britain so as well at the said my name is Guy Brittle.
Our full name is Oma Natera, the Slovenian Foundation for Sustainable Development.
So our main focus is said is sustainable development and.
Probably it would be best first to describe what that is.
They are very different.
Definitions, but I chose the one which is best describing what we do.
The definition comes from the Document Agenda 21 for Slovenia and summarizes basically the qualities of sustainable society as follows.

So respect for the Community of life and for for its responsibility improving quality of life, sustaining the vitality and diversity of the Earth, reduction of the exhaustion of non renewable resources as radically as possible.
Taking into account the carrying capacity of the Earth, changing personal attitudes and behavior, training the community for independent and responsible environmental management.
Development of national framework for connecting Development and conservation.
And last but not least, creating a global alliance.

So our mission is translating these principles of sustainable development into a way of life by introducing some inspiring good practices, an increasing their availability, availability of Ben Avalent products because our vision is Slovenia as a sustainable society, and we try to achieve this by 4 different strategic areas.
Low Carbon SoC social adjust SoC locali selfie.
Relion SoC and what we call the Good Society, which basically means that the non government sector is equivalent to the public and the private one.
We have different projects by which we're trying to get closer to our vision, and I will emphasize just three of them, which are which are programs already from the macro level to the micro?
The first one is Plan B for Slovenia.
It's actually a network of Slovenian environmental NGO's, nongovernmental organizations and experts.
It's forming a broad civil society platform for sustainable development in Slovenia, along with also other interested stakeholders.
This primary objective of this platform is to support a long term, sustainable operation of environment NGOs.
We would like to strengthen their qualifications.

By encouraging directive role in Democratic processes and also by encouraging their participation and partnership, the second objective is to improve the awareness of citizens also by encouraging them to engage in environmentally oriented public matters.
So we we try to achieve these objectives by networking information collaborations and professional training, strengthening civil dialogue international and also you level.
And by promoting policies, programs and some joint activities of the network.
Moving on to the private sector.
So as we know, on the global level we extract resources.
We manufacture products and deliver services in a way that is harming our environment and also our personal health.
Omono Terra started with the program Green Office in 2008.
It's called it Wally Green office.
It's working with businesses and public institutions to promote environmentally sound practices in offices so it has different pillars.
As you can see on the slide, Anet tries to provide comprehensive support for companies and organizations, public public businesses, not businesses organizations.
Yes, that wish to reduce their effects on the environment, so it provides counseling, education, collaboration of like minded people and also facilitating the exchange of.
Experience, so the vision of the project is actually to establish a critical mass of companies to move into a low carb.
In society.
And the last is our project of the catalog of ethical gifts called Krill.
Some translation wings.

It's gifts with magic powers, and this project was presented in 2007 an It's an ethical and sustainable way of gift giving, where each gift in the catalog represents a good work or an L support for socially responsible project.
For example, education of children in Ghana or support for the Slovenian clown doctors or preservation of rainforests and so on.

It is by buying some such a gift swing in public organizations of all kinds, and also enterprises are given an alternative to often senseless an exaggerated consumerism, that of course it was talked already about is leading to exploitation of natural resources, waste of energy, climate change and also degradation of societal values and increasing the gap between the developing and developed countries so.
By doing these kinds of gifts, you can actually withdraw from these stereotypes.

You can demonstrate your beliefs and values and show off show off what you believe in, so it's also one small step towards a better world, and I think together we promote better environment to live in and thank you very much.
